CatDescriptText: Mr. Melvin Roberts, 548 Seagirt Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete [sic]  out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: �Yes, I believe in shipping to a certain extent.  This should be done by the parents and the teachers.  The reason is that it keeps the child from having too much freedom.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Melvin Roberts, wearing light colored corduroy four pocket button down jacket, eyeglasses, and dark military style hat, standing in front of concrete facade
